taskMan

Class Task

  • java.lang.Object
    • taskMan.Task
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Dependant

    public class Task
extends java.lang.Object
implements Dependant
    The Task object. A task always has a description, a state, a link to the resource manager, an estimated duration, an acceptable deviation to this duration and a map of required resources mapping abstract resource types to their required quantity. A task can replace a failed task. Tasks can also serve as prerequisites to other tasks. Before a task can start, it should be planned first. Information related to the planning (such a time related task details) is kept in a Planning object.
    Author:
    Tim Van den Broecke, Joran Van de Woestijne, Vincent Van Gestel, Eli Vangrieken

     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Create a new Task.

        taskDescription - The description of the new Task.
        estimatedDuration - The estimated duration of the new Task.
        acceptableDeviation - The acceptable deviation of the new Task.
        resMan - | The link to the resource manager

        requiredResources - | The required resource types for this task and their required quantity
        alternativeFor - | The task this task will replace
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any of the parameters are invalid ( smaller than 0 or null)

    • Method Detail

      • register

        public boolean register(Dependant t)
        Register a new dependant to the current task. If a task registers to this task and it this task is Finished, it immediately calls notify(this) on the registering task. If this task is failed and has a finished alternative, it also immediately calls notify(this) on the registering task.
        Parameters:
        t - | The new dependant
        Returns:
        true if the dependant was added

        True when it is valid, false otherwise

      • notifyDependants

        public boolean notifyDependants()
        Notify the dependants of this task that this task has changed. If this task is an alternative for another task then this will let the alternative know to do the same
        Returns:
        True if the dependants were successfully notified

      • hasFinishedEndpoint

        public boolean hasFinishedEndpoint()
        Check if this task has a finished endpoint (this task has finished or if it has failed, a replacement has finished). This check will happen recursively over the possible alternatives until a finished alternative is found (or no finished alternative exists)
        Returns:
        True if the chain of alternatives starting from this task has finished

      • getTimeSpent

        public TimeSpan getTimeSpent(java.time.LocalDateTime currentTime)
        Returns the time spent on the task. If the task is still being worked on, this method will return the time in working time elapsed between the start time and current time. If the task has concluded (hasEnded() = true), this method will return the time in working time elapsed between the start- and end time of the task.
        Parameters:
        currentTime - The current time
        Returns:
        time spent on this task in working time
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - When the start time of the task is after the time given.

      • getAvailabilityPeriodBoundWorkingTimes

        public java.time.LocalTime[] getAvailabilityPeriodBoundWorkingTimes()
        Find the starting and ending working day timestamps bound by availability periods of the required resources
        Returns:
        An array with the first element the starting time and the second element the end time of the new work day hours. They are null if no resource has an availability period.

      • plan

        public boolean plan(java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                    java.util.List<ResourceView> concRes,
                    java.util.List<ResourceView> devs)
        Plan a task in the system from a given start time. Reservations will be made for all the required resources and the developers will be assigned.
        Parameters:
        startTime - | The planned begin time
        concRes - | The resources to plan
        devs - | The developers to assign
        Returns:
        True if the task was planned and all reservations made

      • rawPlan

        public boolean rawPlan(java.time.LocalDateTime startTime,
                       java.util.List<ResourceView> concRes,
                       java.util.List<ResourceView> devs)
        Plan a task in the system from a given start time. Reservations will be made for all the required resources and the developers will be assigned. It is however possible that this planning will conflict with other plannings in the system. It is the responsibility of the user when applying this method to check for conflicts using the findConflictingPlannings and handle these conflicts appropriately. If you want to be sure to not get into an inconsistent state, use planTask instead.
        Parameters:
        startTime - | The planned begin time
        concRes - | The resources to plan
        devs - | The developers to assign
        Returns:
        True if the task was planned and all reservations made

      • getPossibleTaskStartingTimes

        public java.util.List<java.time.LocalDateTime> getPossibleTaskStartingTimes(java.util.List<ResourceView> concRes,
                                                                            java.time.LocalDateTime currentTime,
                                                                            int amount)
        Returns an amount of possible Task starting times.
        Parameters:
        concRes - | The concrete resources to reserve
        currentTime - | The time to start counting from
        amount - | The amount of possible starting times wanted.
        Returns:
        The possible starting times of the Task

      • getRequiredResources

        public java.util.Map<ResourcePrototype,java.lang.Integer> getRequiredResources()
        Retrieve a map of the task's required resources. This map will map an abstract resource type on the quantity required of that resource.
        Returns:
        a map containing the required resources and their respective required quantities
